⊢ (Lim((rank `(c0 × c1)))→ Lim((rank `(c0 ⋃ c1))))
⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌

body.origin: |- wi(wceq(cuni(cuni(cfv(crnk, cxp(c0, c1)))), cfv(crnk, cun(c0, c1))), wb(wlim(cuni(cuni(cfv(crnk, cxp(c0, c1))))), wlim(cfv(crnk, cun(c0, c1)))))

comment: If the rank of a Cartesian product is a limit ordinal, so is the rank of the union of its arguments. (Contributed by NM, 19-Sep-2006.)
